title: Network Tokenization Platform
description: Led development of PCI-DSS compliant network tokenization solution for Visa, Mastercard, Discover, and Amex, improving CNP approval rates by 5-7.5%.
fullDescription: A comprehensive network tokenization platform enabling merchants to convert PANs into network tokens across Visa VTS, Mastercard MDES & SCOF, Discover Tokenization, and Amex DDX. The system handles token lifecycle management, fallback scenarios, issuer edge-cases, and performance optimization.
problem: Card-not-present (CNP) merchants were experiencing suboptimal approval rates due to issuer trust issues with raw PANs and lack of network-level token support.
constraints: Required PCI-DSS Level 1 compliance, direct integration with all four major card networks, and sub-100ms response times for real-time authorization flows.
approach: Built a unified tokenization layer supporting Visa VTS, Mastercard MDES & SCOF, Discover Tokenization, and Amex DDX. Implemented lifecycle management, cryptogram generation, and intelligent fallback logic.
tradeoffs: Chose synchronous token provisioning for reliability over async patterns. Accepted higher integration complexity to support all four networks uniformly.
execution: Rolled out in phases by card network. Led distributed engineering teams with daily standups, sprint planning, and weekly release trains using Terraform and GitHub Actions CI/CD.
outcomes: Improved CNP approval rates by 5-7.5% across different card networks. Enabled secure cross-border digital payments for high-volume merchants including Adobe, Eventbrite, GoFundMe, Groupon, Wix, LastPass, and Crocs.
whatIdImprove: Would invest in more sophisticated fallback analytics to identify issuer-specific patterns earlier.
